channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: John Bolton discusses Marco Rubio's dual roles in government
item.description: Marco Rubio is now secretary of state and acting national security advisor. NPR speaks with former national security adviser John Bolton about whether it's really possible to juggle both roles.

item.title: When asked if he needs to uphold Constitution, President Trump says 'I don't know'
item.description: President Trump appeared on "Meet the Press with Kristen Welker" and was asked about the due process rights of immigrants. When asked if a he needs to uphold the Constitution, he said, "I don't know."

item.title: NIH cuts baby 'Safe to Sleep' team. Here's what parents should know
item.description: For three decades the NIH has led 'Safe to Sleep,' helping parents reduce the risk of sudden infant death syndrome (SIDS) and other sleep-related injuries. The NIH cuts come as cases have been rising.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says "I don't know" when asked whether he needs to uphold Constitution, Israel plans to limit way food aid distributed in Gaza, Sean 'Diddy' Combs' sex trafficking trial begins.

item.title: Ruth E. Carter discusses 2025 Met Gala theme 'Superfine: Tailoring Black Style'
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Ruth E. Carter, an Oscar-winning costume designer, about the 2025 Met Gala theme "Superfine: Tailoring Black Style."

item.title: Lawsuit challenges Trump tariffs, saying he has overstepped constitutional authority
item.description: NPR speaks with Ilya Somin, a lawyer who has teamed up with the Liberty Justice Center, to challenge Trump's tariffs in court. He claims Trump's trade decisions overstep his constitutional authority.

item.title: Brazilian police say they foiled bomb plot targeting free Lady Gaga concert in Rio
item.description: Police in Brazil say they foiled a bomb plot targeting Lady Gaga's free weekend concert in Rio de Janeiro that was attended by more than 2 million people, according to organizers.

item.title: REAL ID rolls out on Wednesday. What that means for travel in the U.S.
item.description: Starting Wednesday, the rules for flying within the U.S. will change as REAL ID rolls out. NPR's A Martinez speaks with travel editor Clint Henderson of The Points Guy to bring us up to speed on it.

item.title: NPR listeners tell us about their most memorable Mother's Day gifts
item.description: Mother's Day is coming next weekend. "Morning Edition" hears from listeners about their most memorable Mother's Day gifts.
